intro: Microchilus major, commonly known as the greater microchilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture. Microchilus major is relatively rare and requires specific growing conditions to flourish.
